stream_context.summary: Kaze and team work on Course 11 – an oil-rig/tower stage where Bowser’s minions stage a strike. Tasks covered: new textures (oil monster, rusty blocks, windows), Wiggler rigging/animation, NPC protest dialogue, performance testing on real N64, and detailed design of Bowser’s office interior, elevator secret and Act 3 boss trigger.

development_findings.summary: Performance on real N64 improved to 25-29 FPS after multiple micro-optimisations; only the distant tower is culled because further culling would hurt visuals.
development_findings.quote: Considering how big of a level it is to still get like 29 FPS, 27, fine.

development_findings.summary: Created ‘pop-in smoothing’: distant enemies scale into the ground, then rise when in range, hiding LOD popping.
development_findings.quote: You see how he smoothly scaled, and now when I come close, he comes back out of the ground.

development_findings.summary: Oil-block enemy model finished; texture colour adjusted from ‘brick of shit’ to blue-rust; eyes switched to white for visibility.
development_findings.quote: I made his eyes white because when they were black you could barely see them.

development_findings.summary: Thwomps, Tox Boxes and Koopas will ‘hop’ in place during the protest; textures dirtied, angry expressions added; signs may be attached only to Koopas to avoid animation complexity.
development_findings.quote: I kind of really only want to give one of these a sign, though… and I think it should be Koopas.

development_findings.summary: Bowser’s tower interior plan: lobby with sleeping receptionist, elevator cut-scene, mid-shaft escape for Yoshi coin, top floor window where player eavesdrops on Bowser; leaving building clears plaza and triggers Strike-Breaker boss.
development_findings.quote: You enter there, and he's going to be really, really upset… then you come back out… plaza's empty… black comes out and just eats you.

development_findings.summary: Act-specific scripting: Act 1 Bowser complains about fleet; Act 2 about workforce; Act 3 triggers cut-scene and boss.
ChatGPT used to prototype protest one-liners; final lines hand-picked and formatted into SM64 text IDs.
development_findings.quote: It understood the format... crazy that it understood the assignment.

development_findings.summary: Root-bone of Wiggler rig moved from chest to first body segment to allow usable IK; Zeina re-animating walk cycle in segments.
development_findings.quote: The root… on his chest… you need to redo it — somewhere like in the middle.

development_findings.summary: Multiplayer will be revisited after quaternion animation system; expected floor 20 FPS on N64.
development_findings.quote: I'm planning to add multiplayer after we have Quaternion animations… lowest it will run is like 20 FPS.

development_findings.summary: Future idea: large Ocarina of Time hack run ‘like a professional studio’ with GitHub, open positions and QA; cartridges would not be sold to avoid legal risk.
development_findings.quote: I was thinking we should develop like an Ocarina of Time hack… we'll just role-play as being a professional game studio.

context_findings.summary: Kaze dislikes ‘cringe’ meme references and prefers in-world humour; will not add shout-outs or random memes.
context_findings.quote: Adding random memes to your hacks is just cringe, unless it's specifically a meme hack.

context_findings.summary: He is performance-obsessed, repeatedly testing on real hardware and willing to drop effects (e.g., back-face culling) if they cost FPS.
He openly worries about legalities of selling OST or physical goods using Nintendo samples/trademarks; would consult a lawyer before merchandising.
context_findings.quote: I would have to look into whether it's legal to sell the OST if it has a few samples that are also used in Mario 64.

context_findings.summary: Uses ChatGPT as a productivity tool but jokes about replacing writers; acknowledges need for human curation.
context_findings.quote: They're going to replace all the writers with Biobak — they're all gonna be jobless.

context_findings.summary: Mood swings between frustration (rigging issues) and excitement when ideas click (Bowser tower sequence).

biobak.summary: Suggested recolouring oil-block texture to toned-down blue-rust and offered to supply two-part texture set.
biobak.quote: I'll just send you two textures and then you can do what you want.

biobak.summary: Provided new window texture concept for Bowser’s tower; helped decide on extrusion and placement.
Supplied angry Koopa eyes and helped craft pun-filled protest dialogue, often outperforming ChatGPT.
biobak.quote: Biobak's giving us better answers than ChatGPT.

zeina.summary: Working all day on difficult Wiggler animation; resolved bone hierarchy so segments animate independently.
zeina.quote: I'll try animating Wiggler with the… root moved; much better.

key_stories.title: Designing the Bowser Protest Boss Trigger
key_stories.summary: Kaze wanted Act 3 to feel different. He devised a sequence where players enter Bowser’s office, overhear him hire a strike-breaker, then exit to a suddenly empty plaza before being swallowed into the boss arena.
key_stories.challenge: Make the narrative clear and surprising without confusing players or wasting prior dialogues.
key_stories.process: Sketched tower layout, scripted Bowser monologues per act, planned elevator cut-scene and music drop, documented steps in design notes.
key_stories.outcome: Finalised plan to build lobby, elevator, secret shaft, window eavesdrop and plaza wipe; coding to start next session.
key_stories.key_quote: As soon as you leave Bowser's tower, everyone is gone and the music has gone quiet… then the block comes out and just eats you.

key_stories.title: Oil-Block Texture Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Initial oil-block model looked like ‘a brick of shit.’ The team reworked colours to maintain oily, rusty feel while fitting palette.
key_stories.challenge: Original brown texture read as poop and eyes were invisible.
key_stories.process: Biobak proposed blue-rust palette; Kaze brightened teeth and turned eye whites white; iterative in-stream critiques.
key_stories.outcome: Accepted two-texture solution; oil-block now matches level aesthetics and readability.
key_stories.key_quote: Why did you make them look like poop?

key_stories.title: Fixing Wiggler’s Impossible Rig
key_stories.summary: Zeina couldn’t animate Wiggler because the root bone sat on its chest, locking movement.
key_stories.challenge: Animation controls unusable; segment rotations impossible.
key_stories.process: Team identified un-parented root, moved it to first body segment, experimented with hierarchy; Zeina re-started animation.
key_stories.outcome: Rig now animatable; walk cycle work resumes.
key_stories.key_quote: Now you can't animate him at all anymore… The root makes more sense on the first body segment.
